definition: Inactive for a time but able to become active later.
examples: The volcano is dormant now.
Some seeds stay dormant through winter.

definition: Graceful and stylish in appearance or manner; pleasingly clever and simple.
examples: She wore an elegant dress to the concert.
The proof used an elegant idea.

extra.memory_tip: Elegant = easy on the eye and mind.

definition: To burst out suddenly; for a volcano to explode and send out lava and ash.
examples: The crowd erupted with cheers.
The volcano erupted during the night.

extra.memory_tip: Erupt = energy rushes up and out.

definition: To dig out earth carefully to find things or make a hole.
examples: Archaeologists excavated an ancient house.
We excavated a trench for the pipes.

definition: To force out or send away.
examples: Octopuses expel ink when scared.
The school expelled two pupils for cheating.

extra.memory_tip: Expel = push out; note ‘expelled/expelling’ doubles the L.

definition: Strong-smelling gas or vapour; to be very angry or give off smoke or vapour.
examples: Paint fumes made the room unpleasant. (noun)
He fumed at the long delay. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Fume = fumes in the air or fury in the face.

definition: Melted by heat and turned to liquid.
examples: Molten lava flowed down the slope.
The smith poured molten metal into a mould.

definition: All the people or animals living in a place.
examples: The city’s population is growing.
Scientists tracked the penguin population.

extra.memory_tip: Population = how many live in a location.

definition: An action or event that comes before something more important; a short introductory piece of music.
examples: The shower was a prelude to the storm.
The pianist began with a Bach prelude.

definition: To burn with hot liquid or steam; a burn caused by hot liquid or steam.
examples: Be careful not to scald your hand with boiling water. (verb)
The scald on his arm healed quickly. (noun)
They climbed a stupendous mountain ridge.
The show was a stupendous success.

extra.memory_tip: Stupendous = so good it leaves you stupefied.

definition: To die or cause to die from not being able to breathe.
examples: Thick smoke can suffocate people.
Crowded roots can suffocate a plant.

extra.memory_tip: Suffocate = suffer from lack of air.

definition: A small shaking movement; a slight earthquake or a quiver in the body.
examples: A tremor rattled the cups on the shelf.
He felt a tremor in his hands from the cold.

definition: A cold, treeless plain with frozen ground, found in Arctic regions.
examples: Moss and lichen cover the tundra.
Caribou migrate across the tundra each year.

definition: Strong, healthy, and full of energy; done with force or energy.
examples: She gave the rug a vigorous shake.
Daily vigorous exercise improves fitness.
